title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 197.12 - Income accounts, purpose of
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 197.12 - Income accounts, purpose of

State Regulations

The income accounts (401 to 460) are designed to show for
each month the amounts of operating revenues and operating expenses applicable
to electric and other operations subject to the jurisdiction of the commission; the returns upon securities owned and from property not used in operations; the
amounts accrued for taxes, uncollectible revenues, and use of moneys, and for
exclusive use of properties of others constituting a distinct operating unit; and reservations and appropriations of income. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16
ยง
197.12

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
